attributes.comment:
The increase in adoption fees outlined in U.S. Citizenship and Immigration
Services proposed rule docket number USCIS-2006-0044 are unfounded and
unnecessary. For the American citizens that adopt children, the process of
adoption is already a lengthy, trying process as well as expensive. Making it a
more expensive and involved process accomplishes nothing except the addition of
income to the respective government agency.

In addition, some adopting families who have filed applications recently will
now have to start all over and pay the new higher fees to adopt and receive no
refund of the amount paid for the previous application. This is nothing
short of highway robbery.

Let it be known that I am hereby opposed to U.S. Citizenship and Immigration
Services proposed rule docket number USCIS-2006-0044 and do not wish for it to
be passed.

Sincerely,

Samuel H. Richardson

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Samuel Richardson
